Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

Q:

This function returns a bunch of return data, but I only want one value - is there a simpler way to use it?

A:

Yes, throughout Miles, it is legal to pass in zero for almost every return pointer. If the pointer you pass Miles is zero, then it just doesn't set that return value.

For example, in AIL_sample_ms_position both the total length of the sample and the current position are returned. If you just need the total length, you can pass in zero for the current position parameter and Miles just won't return it.
